timeline.bodyText:
Any specific reason to start the server using this executor service?
If we don't, we can use customExecutor to stop all server processing by shutting down the customExecutor during shutdown call before exit.
timeline.author: ap891843

timeline.bodyText: So, it creates a new executor on each call?
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Initial solution was based on util-class, yes I will make this single-loaded
replies.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: Could you, please, rewrite it to avoid using the LangServerCtx? We plan to get rid of this class
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Ok, then   both server  and customExecutor  via constructor.  LangServerCtx is used in test, but can be removed.
replies.author: asatklichov

replies.bodyText:
Could you, please, rewrite it to avoid using the LangServerCtx? We plan to get rid of this class

As a part of  #621 this will be refactored
replies.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: Will schedule each task in a new executor
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText:
Will schedule each task in a new executor

done
replies.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: Why are you bind CustomThreadPoolExecutor in two modules? I think that we can define it only in one place.
timeline.author: grianbrcom

replies.bodyText: I created a new #621 to refactor our DI modules, there are are already duplications in app
replies.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText:
I suppose that this getter also must return the same ThreadPool each time.
I see that you want to rewrite getScheduledThreadPoolExecutor, I just want to mark this place for not to forget.
timeline.author: grianbrcom

replies.bodyText:
I suppose that this getter also must return the same ThreadPool each time.
I see that you want to rewrite getScheduledThreadPoolExecutor, I just want to mark this place for not to forget.

done
replies.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: Why do you store those values?
timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Why don't store the executors without maps?
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText:
Why don't store the executors without maps?
I will change it, but honestly initial solution (static class) was quite sufficient for our case. These injected services are exceeding its role.
replies.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: The name doesn't reflect the purpose of the class. It is either a Provider that just holds and returns the executors or an Executor, but in this case, it should not expose the nested executors and just provide the API to control the tasks.
timeline.author: temanbrcom
